text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
a rainbow push pop tutorial where I'll
be showing you how to make these bright
very bright rainbow push pops if you
haven't seen push pops around they have
exploded onto the scene about twelve
months ago so basically a tall clear
container on a stick and you buy them I
bought these ones on eBay they came out
to me in about a week or so from the US
so if you're in the u.s. watching this
you should be able to get them a lot
faster and I think of memory there were
about sixty cents each I've got
something about perfectly pipeable
buttercream frosting if you don't have a
great recipe for a really nice and piper
book consistency of frosting you can
click on this frosting at any time
during this tutorial to go and have a
look at our recipe and video I've got
that in a piping bag and I've got a
lower number nine plastic star nozzle
you can use any nozzle you like I'm
going with a start because it's a bit
prettier but you can use around anything
you like I've got a serrated edge knife
I've got a cookie cutter and I've just
picked the cookie cutter in my set that
fits snugly into that push pop container
I've got some cupcakes now this is not a
traditional rainbow color I don't have
all the colors of the rainbow I'm using
a pink a green a yellow and a blue
purely personal preference and I've got
some sprinkles just to finish off now to
begin with I want my darker color down
the bottom so I'm going to take that
cookie cutter and I'm just going to cut
that shape out of the cupcake don't
throw that out you could perhaps use
that to make some of our beautiful
rainbow cake pops we've got those on our
channel I'll leave a link in the
description box below now cut the top
off so you've got a nice flat top to
start working with and you should get
about three from each cupcake so one two
three there's your three little blue
pieces and we're going to repeat that
now with the other colors
all right now that we've got our little
stacks of little pieces of cake it is as
simple as making sure that your pushpop
container is right down the bottom the
little plate that your cake is going to
sit on now I like to put just a little
bit of frosting in the bottom and that's
just going to stick the cake down so I'm
going to go blue and you should just be
able to drop it in and push it down
you can see that a little bit of frost
in a little bit of cake the great thing
about push pops is they will actually
protect the sides of your cake from
drying out so they're not exposed to the
air it's not a little bit of frosting
don't put too much and you don't want to
over frost and I'm going to pop the
green and just push it down you can see
that by using that star piping tip I'm
actually getting a little bit of texture
in that push pop lovely texture that
we're getting in the frosting there and
finish it off with a nice little bit of
pink now to give it a nice push down so
that you've got it all well within that
lovely push pop container and you'll see
if it leads are a little bit raised
they've given us a little bit of room to
do a little swirl just a really nice low
one and add a couple of sprinkles
pop your lids on there you have your
gorgeous rainbow push pops ready to go
for any rainbow occasion why not to mess
up with some of our other fantastic
rainbow items you can see I've got quite
a few of them on my channel I'm a little
bit rainbow crazy feel our tutorials
make sure that you do subscribe to our
channel my cupcake addiction we upload
several times a week and we'd love to
have you drop by thanks very much for
watching
you
